greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Series(W(exp(1)*(1+x)), x) = sum( a[ n ]/(2^(2*n)*n!), n=0..infinity), where W is the Lambert W function.
comment: The n-th derivative of W(x) at x=exp(1) is exp(-n) * a(n) / 2^(2*n). - _Paolo Bonzini_, Jun 23 2016
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..150
maple: seq(n!*coeff(series(LambertW(exp(1)*(1+4*x)), x, n+1), x, n), n=0..20); # _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Jul 09 2013
mathematica: max = 17; (Series[ ProductLog[E*(1 + 4*x)], {x, 0, max}] // CoefficientList[#, x] &)*Range[0, max]! (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jun 20 2013 *)
program: a(n):= if n<2 then n+1 else 2*(n-1)!*(sum((binomial(n+k-1, n-1)*sum(binomial(k, j)*2^(n-j-1)*sum(binomial(j, l)*(-1)^(l)*sum((l^(n+j-i-1)*binomial(l, i))/(n+j-i-1)!, i, 0, l), l, 1, j), j, 1, k)), k, 1, n-1)); \\ based on A042977, _Paolo Bonzini_, Jun 23 2016
results.author: Robert Corless (rmc(AT)pineapple.apmaths.uwo.ca)
ext: More terms from _N. J. A. Sloane_.
